reviewText: I loved working out to the 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift because it was easy for me and being a beginner it was great. I like that you can customize your workout and give your body exactly what it needs.The ten minutes are just enough to be effective because I can definitely feel it the next day. The workout is quick and gets easier each time I do them. Simple and quick workout, so there will not be any excuses to do it daily.I've been doing this for over a month and you can begin to see some results now, but I'm sure it will take much longer before I achieve my desired results.
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: I really like this workout.  Its do able, but also challenging.  The exercises I can't do initially, I am able to do a few workouts later, because the other exercises, I can do, strengthen me enough to make the undoable ones, do able.  I love the unique and the standard workouts. The variation on types of movements keeps me interested and keeps my muscle guessing, which keeps them from getting lazy and complacent. I feel strong in my everyday activities. I have better balance and coordination. I highly recommend it!
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: This is a great workout. The trainer is bright and talks just the right amount- not too much, not irritating and she is a little tough- she admits a move is hard and then says Keep going and moves on. These are short but you can put them together and make longer workouts. Some of the moves Ive never seen anywhere else and Im a exercise dvd junkie. I really like this dvd and I think others would too.
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: My teen-age daughter helped me test out this dvd when it first arrived.  We thought this would be an easy start to resuming our workouts after a couple months break.  We didn't think it could work us as hard as Jillian Michaels does (our favorite dvd-workouts).  We were wrong.  We were feeling this workout for several days, after doing just two 10-minute sections.The one con for this workout is that it doesn't cue or explain the moves very well.  If you're already familiar with dvd work-outs you'll recognize the moves and be able to follow along more easily than if you're a complete beginner. A beginner will have to watch the instructor carefully for proper form and just practice to get the moves down.I love the ballet-inspired movements in this workout, as they worked my muscles in a way none of our other dvds does.  It was a new element of exercise for us.My favorite part of this dvd is that I can program my workout at the start with a warm-up, any order of the exercise segments, and a cool-down.  It's nice to be able to set it all up at the beginning and then just do it, without having to select another segment mid-way through.
summary: This DVD really works your butt - love the ballet-inspired exercises.
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: NOTE:  I received a free copy of this DVD to review for the web site Metapsychology Online Reviews; please see that site for a more detailed version of my review.10 MINUTE SOLUTION: BUTT LIFT features instructor Christine Bullock, who incorporates her backgrounds in Pilates, yoga, and barre into the different workouts.  As with all the DVDs in the 10 Minute Solution series, there are five 10-minute routines, but this video also offers a bonus sixth workout.  Other than supportive footwear (and an optional mat for floorwork), no equipment is required.  Except where noted, Bullock performs five total exercises in each workout, doing each move for 45 seconds/2 sets.  I have provided additional details below.BUTT LIFTThis first segment is a toning workout designed to target the glutes and hamstrings from different angles and incorporating both floor and standing work.  The five moves are as follows:  1) around the world lunge, 2) kneeling (all fours) kicks, 3) frog (prone) lifts, 4) single leg bridge, and 5) lunge lifts (crescent pose into kicks).  Bullock ends with brief standing hamstring and glutes stretches.CARDIO BOOTY CAMPDuring this cardio segment--which includes some higher impact moves--Bullock talks A LOT about things like fitting into your bikini and "skinny jeans."  She briefly performs "butt kicks" (jogging) as a warm-up and then moves into the following five exercises:  1) warrior lunge (touching the floor), 2) side step lunge (with side kick), 3) plank jacks (adding rear leg lift), 4) tap jacks, and 5) lunge kick.  A quick thigh stretch concludes this workout.UPRIGHT BOOTYAs the name suggests, this entire section--which also focuses on toning--is performed standing.  The exercises are performed all on one side first, and then Bullock repeats the sequence on the second side.  Many of the movements add a rotational element to also work the waist.  The exercises are as follows:  1) staggered squat twist, 2) Charlie's Angel lunge (with side rotation), 3) circle squat, 4) side lunge crunch, and 5) curtsey kicks (a standing split variation).  There is a quick stretch to finish this routine.BUTT & THIGHSBullock states that these are some of her favorite ballet and Pilates moves; this workout includes both standing and floor exercises.  The sequence is as follows:  1) side lunge crossover, 2) thigh fall (kneeling--similar to back dancing), 3) kneeling side kicks (from Pilates), 4) pretzel kick (actually a lift), and 5) single leg circle (standing).  Bullock concludes with quad and side stretches.HIIT BUTT LIFTThe format is a bit different for this segment, as there are eight total moves.  In the style of high intensity interval training, Bullock performs each move for 20 seconds followed by 10 seconds of rest (the rest period is always a held squat).  After the brief warm-up (jumping rope), here are the moves included in this section:  1) lateral plyo squat, 2) scissor jump lunge, 3) power plié, 4) round off lunge, 5) Burpee lunge, 6) side hop squat, 7) knee skips, and 8) cross country squat.  The workout concludes with a hamstring stretch and runner's lunge.AMAZING ABSThis bonus segment again returns to the doing two sets of five exercises for 45 seconds each.  The five included moves are as follows:  1) knee lift/oblique knee lift, 2) alternating passé plank, 3) teaser kick, 4) attitude crunch, and 5) "the stack up" (crunch with one foot resting on other, bringing knees in).  Between sets, Bullock performs a 10-second bridge, and she finishes the routine with a quick cobra and child's pose.With their younger instructors, newer fitness trends (e.g., HIIT training), and higher impact moves, the latest DVDs in the 10 Minute Solution series (including this one and10 Minute Solution: High Intensity Interval Training) seem aimed at a younger, fitter audience.  Throughout the routines in Butt Lift, instructor Christine Bullock offers modifications here and there, but not many, and she moves along at a brisk pace.  Experienced exercisers looking for something new and a bit different are likely to enjoy this DVD, but beginners (or anyone with limitations due to impact, flexibility, etc.) are apt to feel somewhat left behind.
summary: High energy, high impact routines for those who enjoy short but fast-paced workouts
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: I have acquired dozens of workout dvd's over the last 18 months and am in much better shape than I used to be versus going to the gym.  I have been doing mostly Jillian Michaels and Jackie Warner workouts and though I am in good shape, have reached a plateau.I did this DVD yesterday and was pleasantly surprised.  I did the first 40 minutes (4 segments) in the morning and the last 20 minutes (2 segments) in the evening.  I am happy to report that I feel the burn today which is hard to get to once you start working out regularly.  Though the workout is fast paced throughout, I find circuit #5 is hard as well as the last ab exercise in the ab circuit.  Though I have defined abs, I simply could not get through this last set. I will do this workout at least once a week. Amazon also rocked with the fast shipping on this. I think I got it the next day after ordering it.
summary: Probably the best butt workout without weights I have tried!
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: Very good workout, but not geared towards beginners.  Do not get this thinking that because it's a 10 minute workout that it'll be easy!!  There are five different workouts on here and you can pick and choose which ones to do.  I am quite pleased with this DVD and will now be looking into other 10 Minute Solution workouts.
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: A great exercise video with 5 intense butt/thigh exercise routines that are only 10 minutes long (Butt Lift, Cardio Booty Camp, Upright Booty, Butt & Thighs, Butt Lift).  I love how there are 5 different types of routines that depending on your mood you'll have something just right for the day.  It also comes with an added 10 minute abdominal video as well.  Now I have no excuse for missing a day at the gym because I can still get a workout at home.
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: As a user of many of the 10 Minute Solution DVDs, this one is definitely near the top. The variety is great and covers other areas of the body as well as the glutes. The muscles definitely burn after this one! She is a clear instructor who is easy to follow. This a great deal for 60 minutes of calorie burning.There is floor toning, aerobics, ballet, boot camp, and standing toning. There is something for everyone. Many of these can be done if you have joint pain.As with the other 10 minute solution programs, the program is customizable to fit any schedule, as well as the order of workouts to keep things interesting.
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: Well, you can get a LOT done and sweat more than you think a pretty fit person could in 10 minutes.  10 minute solutions has a way of cramming in the most effective use of your time with really targeted exercises to work you out hard.  The beauty of 5 butt exercises and the 1 bonus ab segment is you can put a bunch together (if you don't need to walk again any time soon-just kidding....well kind of...) or you can do one or two together or more depending on what time you can commit.  I did the first four one day and did the last two on a light workout day.  Each is set to work on a different area for an all over toned butt.  I could definitely feel this the next day.  I also liked her combo of moves inspired by ballet, yoga and pilates.  My favorite was most likely the butt & thighs, which had more dance inspired moves and the cardio booty camp with more kick boxing moves.  The hardest for me was the Hiit (high intensity interval training)...in general I tend to not do as well in this and this one will make you breathe hard fast.The instructor is upbeat, demonstrates good form and gets in, works you out and moves on quickly to the next exercise. I liked her style. My one criticism about the video would be the music....not inspiring to say the least, just weird, noisy music, especially the strange siren sound that plays during one segment.  I'm exercising for goodness sake, not getting pulled over for speeding....seems like they could have found something a little better, or no music at all would have been fine also, the instructor really didn't need any background music to make this video any better....she does a fine job.I exercise daily with a variety of workouts, pilates, dance, yoga, kickboxing and have tried other 10 minute solutions videos in the past.  This one is my favorite 10 minute solution dvd and I will definitely be putting this into rotation.  As a person once said...  "If you are going to have a big butt, might as well have a "great" big butt".Overall, excellent for the intermediate exerciser and beyond.  Good all over butt toning and really good ab segment.
summary: who says you can't get much done in 10 minutes?
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: This is a great, challenging workout that keeps you on your toes with a variety of unique exercises. I'm would consider myself intermediate level (work out 5-6 times a week for 30-45 minutes) and this offered a challenge in as little as 10 minutes. Great if you're short on time. You'll feel the burn!
summary: This is a great, challenging workout that keeps you on your toes ...
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: This is legitmately the best butt video on the market.  With a bunch of different 10 minute workouts its great for beginners and you can loop a bunch together for more experienced work-out-ers.  I am sore everytime if I take it seriously and work hard, and I have noticed a real difference after a few weeks of twice a week use.
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: This workout DVD is as advertised. Short, quick segments that you can do in ten minutes. However, I found the exercises to be a bit advanced. This DVD is definitely geared towards people who are already in prime form and just want to work on toning their butt. I think beginners or normal women with normal bodies will have a problem doing some of these exercises and there didn't seem to be a beginner, medium, and advanced level for the segments.The set and instructor are nice to look at and the production quality if great, this is just not a DVD for someone who is not a fitness guru. A normal woman who does not work out every day may have 5-7 minutes out of the ten they can do.
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: This was my first 10 Minute Solution DVD and I can say that I am definitely buying more.  These short, fun segments can be done alone or customized into a longer workout.  I do one a day along with other exercises that I enjoy (Five Tibetans, 100 squats, rebounding).  I find that I am more motivated to stick with a routine of short workouts vs. committing to a long session.  This DVD is challenging.  There are lunges, squats and some interesting ballet moves that really hit the glutes.  The bonus ab segment is a real killer and offered exercises that I have never seen before.  I love the instructor's warm personality and hope that she releases more 10 minute workouts in the future.  These workouts move fast but it isn't too hard to pick up on the moves.  Highly recommended.  I plan on ordering more of these DVDs.
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: As noted in previous reviews, there are five workouts each 10 minutes long which are designed to work your glutes from every angle. And because everything is connected your core and legs get a good workout too. There is also a bonus 10 minute Abs workout.This is a collection of intense (and sweaty) workouts. I completed four of the butt workouts my first time through and I was sore for the next three days (especially deep in the glutes around the sit bones)! Cardio Booty Camp and the HIIT Butt Lift workouts had me puffing and my heart pounding as it really gives a good cardio workout as well.My only concern is because of the 10 minute format, the moves are done pretty quickly. This is fine for some moves, but for lunges or squats for example, the quick moves may mean you are working too hard to keep up with the instructor and not focussed enough on proper form and could therefore hurt your knees. In one of the workouts - Christine has you do "around the world lunges" where you lunge forward, then lunge at a diagonal and then lunge back. She moves quickly which can be tricky as these moves require balance (remember to brace that core!) so I pause the DVD and go at my own pace until I am better at that sequence of moves.I suggest doing a more thorough stretch (especially for your glutes) after the workout as the format does not allow for sufficient stretching. I googled glute stretches for ideas. It's definitely no fun having a very tight butt (no pun intended) from working out daily but with minimal stretching!Christine the instructor has a pleasant engaging personality and explains the moves well. No screechy accent or grating voice here.The workout is fun (the moves varied and interesting - some I haven't seen before) and will definitely kick your butt before your butt gets lifted.
summary: Will kick your butt before it gets lifted!
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: This is the best 10 minute solution dvd I own and I own a lot of them.  In 10 minutes you will feel the burn.  Christine Bullock has picked some creative and easy to learn moves to sculpt your butt, abs, thigh and legs.  I love love the HIIT and cardio sections because they really get your heart rate up and work the muscles. I feel like I can do 10 minutes and feel like I have worked out for 30 minutes and I appreciate that being my schedule is busy.  Ladies and gentlemen you will not be disappointed.  You will get results with this one!
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: This is a good DVD - I do several of her workouts a day (to do about 30 mins), along with other tapes and going to the gym.  She's good!!!
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: This workout was a little hi-impact for me.  I was looking for something to do indoors this winter to replace the 2-mile walk I take outside every day.  Though these are 10-minute workouts, they were a bit tough for a 70-year-old.  However, there are a lot of positive things to be said.  They would be fine for a younger person wanting to keep in shape.  I used to be young and these would have been quite doable in previous decades.  There is enough variety not to get bored, which is always a down side to videos on tape or DVD.  Overall, I would recommend this as a pretty good workout video for someone already working on their fitness; but a bit difficult for a beginner, and a bit more difficult for a senior citizen even if they are working on staying fit.
summary: Could be just right for some people....
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewerName: Leah Marie Brown, Author "Leah Marie Brown, A...
reviewText: For as long as I can remember, I have been told I have a a curvaceous bootie. Well, maybe not as long as I can remember.  I don't recall anyone telling me that when I was in Mrs. Gordon's pre-K class or when I was a card-carrying, cookie-toting Girl Scout (that would be deeply disturbing), but "Baby Got Back" is a phrase I have been familiar with loooonnngg before Sir Mix-a-Lot his now classic anthem.Now that I am (perpetually) 40, I need a good set of exercises that will keep my junk from going south.  The problem:  I hate long exercise routines, especially anything that makes me dance or requires great coordination.  I love 10 MINUTE SOLUTIONS BUTT LIFT.  The exercises are intense but not impossible and the results are great.  Quick work-outs you can do throughout the day to keep that bootie in the North.
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: I love collecting workout DVDs and have close to 300 in my collection.  My weakness is buying workouts that target the butt since that tends to be my biggest weakness.  :-)  I had been wanting to purchase this, and so was thrilled that I could try it as part of Amazon's Vine program.  I really like it, and will use it on a regular basis!This is an intermediate-level workout.  There are five workouts on the DVD, plus a bonus abs workout:*  Butt Lift -- targets the glutes, hamstrings, and lower back*  Cardio Booty Camp -- a kickboxing-based workout*  Upright Booty -- a standing workout*  Butt and Thighs --uses ballet- and barre-inspired moves, with exercises like the pretzel*  HIIT Butt Lift -- a cardio workout that has high-intensity interval training (HIIT) blasts*  Bonus:  Amazing Abs -- a core workoutTo do the workout, you just need some space and a mat, and a pair of supportive athletic shoes since some of the segments have some high-impact cardio. (You don't need weights of any kind.)When you get the main screen of the workout, you have the option of just picking one segment at a time, of playing the whole workout, or of creating your own custom workout (where you choose the order you want to do each segment in).  This is a really nice feature.  If you do select the "Play All," just know that there will be a short warm-up and cool down for each new segment since these are designed to be stand-alone workouts.I did the workout in its entirety this first time doing it so I could get a feel for what it was like. The segments are fun to do, and I really felt them, even though I was just using my own body weight.  Although it is just Christine in the workout and there is no modifier, I think that it's easy to modify each workout if you need to.The instructor, Christine Bullock, is also pleasant and gives good form pointers.  This was my first workout with her, and I really like her personality.I wish that the music was better on this.  If you own a lot of the 10 Minute Solution workouts or workouts where the instructor just uses canned music, you'll recognize a lot of the songs on this.Overall, though, this is a nice addition to your workout library if you like lower-body focused workouts.  It's fun and has some creative moves that I haven't seen on other disks, and, as I mentioned at the start of my review, I can tell that I'll be reaching for this one often.If you're looking for other workouts that target the glutes, I'd also recommend the originalBrazil Butt Lift DVD Workout - Base Kitset and also all of Sylwia Weisenberg's Tonique workouts, especiallySylwia Wiesenberg's Tonique Premier DVDandTonique Born to Move with Sylwia DVD.
summary: Really fun intermediate workouts that target the glutes!
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: My wife wanted to check out the rear exercises and I wanted to see the bonus ab workout. We were both pleased.I'm a veteran martial arts teacher and my wife holds two black belts in two fighting arts, so we're both in good shape. That said, the exercises in this jammed pack DVD made us feel like white belts at times. My wife was grunting away at the rear exercise and I was pleasantly surprised to feel the ab exercises, though we do a tough ab routine in my martial arts class.The exercises are taught quickly and led quickly so viewers new to the exercises might have to rewind a few times to understand what she is doing. But it's worth it because the exercises really do target the muscles in question.Highly recommended.Loren W. Christensen, author of the Fighter's Body
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: There are a lot of lower body workouts out there and I'm going to compare this one with some other recent lower body videos.For some background,  I am a certified fitness instructor and do a TON of DVDs. I am also at an advanced fitness level. I really love this DVD.10 Minute Solution Butt Lift: First let me say that Christine is Very likable, and is not annoying at all. She talks just the right amount. The menu great. You can pre-select the combination and order of the workouts you want to do, which allows you to customize your workout. There are 5 (10 min) workouts. I like that the warmup isn't long at all (and actually barely there) so if you want to do all 5, you are not having to do a long warmup each time. The moves are basic, and some combinations unique. Of the 5 workouts, each one has a different feel. The HIIT isn't very intense, but is a good light cardio workout. It is more of a mini tabata style workout where you do an exercise for 20 seconds and rest for 10, then do it again. Instead of doing it 8 times like in tabata, you only do each drill twice. The floor exercises are good, but I wish they were a little longer, so I find myself rewinding them and doing them again.Here is how it compares to the various other lower body workouts I've recently done:10 Minute Solution Butt lift with Christine Bullock: (released 2013)More Pilates/ballet based, with a little bit of athletic cardio for two of the 5 workouts. Not an extreme calorie blasting DVD, but you will get your heart rate up a bit. I think this is great for all levels of fitness, but if you are super advanced, you may need to repeat some exercises to really feel it. The menu is great, the moves are great, the instructor is very motivating. I think I will add this to my weekly routine. I really really enjoyed this workout.Ultimate Sweat and Tone with Angie Gorr: (released 2013)This is a total body workout but has a 60 min lower body calorie torcher pre-mix. My watch said I burned about 800 calories doing this. This was intense, and I really felt it the next day. The leg tap series is really unique, and time just flew by. You can do this without a step to make it easier, or with a step to make it harder. This is more of a cardio/strength athletic style workout, where Butt Lift is more pilates/ballet based with a little bit of athletic style moves thrown in.Tonique Premier with Sylwia (not super recent, 2008) but I just discovered it:This is great for cardio as well as toning. I don't feel the toning as much with this one as I did with 10 Minute Solution Butt Lift or Ultimate Sweat and Tone, but you can make it harder by adding heavier weights (Sylwia uses 2lbs). There are 3 main sections (each 20 min long). The first 20 min you do all variations of squats (typically 30 reps of each type) and then the next 20 min is variations of lunges (30 reps of each type) and the last is the mat series (which is really good) and then finishes up with abs.Cathe Friedrich's XTrain Series: Cardio Leg Blast DVD (2012)OK, so Cathe is probably the best instructor out there. However, this wasn't my favorite DVD, but it was good. I think this is more of an intermediate level workout, rather than advanced. Tonique and Ultimate sweat and tone mentioned above are more high-rep workouts. Butt lift and Leg Blast is more of a medium-rep workout. I found myself wanting to do a few more reps to really feel it. However, some people prefer this style where you are changing exercises more often and not doing as many reps. I throw this workout in to get a variety, and like I said..you can't go wrong with Cathe.Tracy Effinger: Squeeze Lower Body ChallengeI really Like Tracy, but I think I like 10 Min Butt lift better. Tracy; however does do a lot of reps, which I really like. I don't get my heart rate up, but sometimes I'll go for a run and then throw this in. She has some GREAT leg exercises. I think I like her actual Squeeze a little better than Squeeze Lower Body Challenge.Cardio Barre Ultimate Advanced DVD With Bonus Workouts (2008)The cardio part isn't super intense, but the toning is the hardest out of any of the DVDs mentioned. I love this workout, but don't like that I don't get that cardio burst I need in the other workouts. However, this is VERY challenging and I can't finish it. I guess my goal for 2014 is to finish this workout!I've done a TON of DVD's and I've listed some of my favorites, and 10 Minute Solution Butt Lift was just added to it. I'll make it simple. If you are more of a pilates/ballet/barre person you will like this video. If you are advanced and prefer higher reps, cardio and strength you would probably like Ultimate sweat and Tone or Tonique Premiere; however, I strongly encourage people to go beyond their comfort zone. If you are not a pilates/ballet/barre person, this is actually the perfect video to bridge that gap because Christine doesn't do ALL pilates/ballet. She throws in other varieties of exercises, and would be a great challenge for those that are not used to it. If you want an overall toning video with high reps and very little cardio, then Tracy Effinger is the way to go. If you are extremely advanced and want a killer barre video, then cardio barre is your best bet.I have to say that I just really liked Christine, and no matter what your preference is on workouts, I always encourage my students to try new instructors and get out of their comfort zone. I would highly recommend adding 10 Minute Solution Butt Lift to your collection!***Also for those of you that mentioned Knee injuries or needing low-impact. This DVD has a variety of both, so depending on your issue and your ability to modify, you may want to stick with a pure low-impact DVD like Tracy Effinger or actually Cathe has an entire low-impact series you could choose from.
summary: Great Workout love the menu options!
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: Overall, this is a fun and different workout and it felt effective as well.  It is now one of my favorite "toning" 10 Minute Solutions Workouts, and it offers a good mix and variety of moves.  Some segments are more athletic, but overall it's not a standard athletic set.  Every 10 minute segment moves quickly and reps are even from side to side.  Stretching is included but minimal.  There are a good mix of standing and floor exercises.  Almost all moves are done at a near cardio rate (this is intentional; this is intended as a fat burning, not simply strength, dvd).  One segment included a mix of jacks and moves-facing-away-from-the-TV, so that was easily my least favorite and possibly one I will skip.  Overall, I really like this workout and would rate it 4 stars.  I would have considered giving it 4.5 stars if that were an option.Like all 10 Minute Solutions Workouts, the segments are all fully programmable to create a custom workout.My thoughts on the instructor:  She's bright and friendly, speaks clearly and engages with the camera.  But she's got this almost fake, nearly childlike, too perky, "happy voice" quality that I prevents her from being a favorite.  Aside from that she cues well, and does occasionally offer safety pointers (the ubiquitous "knees behind the toes" lunge warning, reminders for shoulder positions, etc).  However she does not offer a lot of form tweaking pointers (a few).  Also, while she cues clearly she does not "cue ahead" which means that she describes a move she IS doing rather than upcoming moves, so you have to watch her (and when she has you in a floor-facing position, that's an issue).  As an instructor, I would give her 4 out of 5 stars, and I imagine that she can only improve in future videos, so I would give another DVD from her a try.I wish that the DVD had included background exercisers.  Occasionally, modifications are offered, so the instructor switches to the modification rather than original exercise.  This seems to disturb the rhythm (for instance, during a multi-part move the modification may be "just lunge"). I would have preferred seeing a backgrounder doing the modifications; partially for the rhythm, but also as it would have provided an earlier peak at the modification.  Some modifications offered are simply "just go slower."
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: I have a LOT of video workouts.  Back when they first started coming out, I didn't enjoy these workouts because every single segment had a warm up and cool down embedded in it.  It was really annoying when you were doing multiple segments.  This DVD didn't seem to have much, if any warm up and very little cool down.  It worked for me because I did a workout before this DVD and was already warmed up, but long term would like to have them.  Given that they are into using the DVD technology to let you customize your workouts, why in the world do they not film a warm up and cool down separately and let people choose them as part of the customized workout?As far as the workout itself, it's pretty good as long as you don't have problematic joints.  She gives some modifications, but not enough to help someone who isn't at the fitness level of the workout.  As another review said, if you have knee or back or wrist issues, you will either need to modify many of the moves or risk injury.Other than this lack, the instructor is pretty good.  She gives good instruction and good form pointers.  Her cueing is good and I was with her as she started new moves.The moves to target the glutes and many the moves were new to me or had twists on old favorites.  When I finish a workout with this DVD, I feel it in my butt.
summary: Good workouts.  Not enough modifications shown/given
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: If You enjoy a really good work out, and want to really feel that you are getting one,  then this 10 Minute Solution Butt Lift is for you.  If you just want to hope for the best and have an easy workout, then don't buy this DVD.Me, my Granddaughter and my Daughter ( 3 Generations ) all did this DVD together.  We got a very good workout and it kicked our butt.. in a good way.  We could all feel it in our butt muscles.My Granddaughter liked it so much that she took it and won't give it back.
summary: 3 Generations Getting Their Butt Kicked Together
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: Let me start by saying that I love the fact that I can opt to only do a short workout when I am really pressed for time.  I have school age children and a baby so some days are just better than others.  I did manage to somehow stay in better shape during this last pregnancy than the one prior but as I lose the baby weight my butt actually looks worse than when the extra padding was present.  So, I like the lift and definition that this workout has given my normally on the flat side rear view.  The five workouts offered give variety and the ab workout is a bonus.  A wide range of ages can benefit but keep in mind that this is not as low impact as say yoga.
summary: Great Butt Workout for this 40 year old...
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: Being a yoga teacher, I've constantly been on the search for ways to diversify my tush routine. There may be thousands of yoga poses, but sadly the butt lifting department is sorely lacking. Fortunately, this DVD has come to the rescue.This DVD succeeds on two levels. First, offering six options is a great way to maximize value from a 60 minute workout DVD. I've used this for a few weeks off and on and have not grown tired of it at all.Perhaps more importantly, these workout are hard. You'll can really push yourself in those ten minutes. If not, you can always do it again.This is a workout DVD that really gives you a lot of bang for your buck. I highly recommend it.
summary: On My Way to the Butt I've Always Wanted
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: Great workouts.  They may be short, but you do feel the muscles you are working out.  If you are consistent and use every day you will see changes.  Great to use when your short on time, but want to do something.  Stack them up in any order for your own workout set up.
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: As an avid home exerciser with upwards of 500 workout DVDs, I'm in a good position to be able to compare this with other workouts on the market.  I liked the 10-minute segments in this one, and I liked that each exercise was 45 seconds (if there's one you don't like, it won't be long before you move on).  I found the instructor pleasant and creative.  The thing that was missing for me was the fun factor.  Of the five segments, the only one I found fun was "Upright Booty."  The others were not bad by any means -- but they felt more like "something to get through" rather than something I would look forward to doing.  Nevertheless, the DVD overall is effective and can be useful in anyone's collection.
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: The Good:The set is pretty. This is well-filmed. The instructor is gorgeous and easy to understand. The exercises are creative, and they look really difficult.The Bad:This is either high-impact or requires a range of motion in your knees that is beyond the range of most people over twenty-five; unless you are a really serious exerciser already, and you have never had a knee injury, this is not a dvd that is doable.
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: This workout is geared towards younger women so women of an average body type who are over 45 as I am are going to need to modify some of the exercises. I do a lot of workouts so it was easy to adapt the exercises to what I knew my body could handle.There are a few sections which are high impact but mostly it just seemed like the exercises were done fairly quickly. What I did notice that even at my slower pace I did feel a burn. The instructor has a very chatty style and is very concerned about how we will look in a bikini. I mostly wanted to shape up to strengthen my body not show it off. So maybe this workout will appeal to people in their 20s. It seems that is what most workouts are made for these days.Some of the moves also require a lot of balance so I'd say this workout is more for those who are intermediate. Beginners are going to find it difficult to keep up.The only thing that annoys me about these 10 Minute Solution workouts is some of the set. There is some frosted glass on the left side of the room that makes things look blurry on my TV. And I don't understand the appeal of the chalkboard. It makes things look messy. This workout also has a short ab workout. I did all six segments at once and survived. But you can mix and match.~The Rebecca Review
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: 10 Minute Solution Butt Lift with Christine Bullock includes 5 10-minute workouts with a bonus 10-minute ab workout.  The instructor is adorable and her enthusiasm is contagious.  She makes you want to follow along even when it may be a bit more difficult than you would think.  Who knew 10-minutes could work so many muscle groups?  But I didn’t wake up the next day unable to walk so I was still able to function.These 10 Minute Solution DVDs are great because they have a menu that allows you to pick and choose your workout.  You can start with abs, do a workout with a lot of squats, and move to a cardio workout for a full 30 minutes of exercise or you can just do 10 minutes or do a whole hour.  You have control over what you do when and that’s wonderful.  My only complaint is that the instructor doesn’t offer modifications immediately.  Each exercise is typically done for 45 seconds and one leg will be worked through a series before moving to the other leg but the modifications come after a few too many repetitions for me.Nonetheless, I think the workouts are the perfect level of challenging.  Yes, some of the workouts were too difficult for me to do but I have a balance disorder so I don’t expect to be able to do all of the exercises on a DVD like this.  Plus, I have faith that the stronger I get, the more easily I’ll move through even the workouts I cannot do now.So if you like your instructors on the perky side, enjoy a challenging and focused workout, and also like to have the power to choose your routine, this DVD is a brilliant choice.
summary: Fun and Focused Workouts That Give You the Control
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: I have been a fan of 10 minute solution products for some time. They allow you to get in a quick workout, or a longer one, according to the time you have.  I have always found the instruction to be good, and the camera angles and studios to be appropriate to the exercise (i.e. easy to follow).  A recent change to the format that I liked - it was even easier to set up a custom workout, as the DVD assumes you will want to do this.This video focuses, as the name says, on the butt.  Two days later, I can tell you that I feel EVERY muscle in my butt, having done forty minutes with the DVD.  A total of sixty minutes of instruction is available, but I am currently prohibited by my surgeon (just had surgery six weeks ago) from doing cardio.  The DVD includes 5 glute-focused workout, and one bonus ab workout.  Of the five ten-minute butt exercises, two of the workouts are more cardio, two are strength, and another one is ballet/pilates.Now, I haven't worked out for six weeks and I've lost a lot of muscle from my post-surgical diet, so I'm not in the same condition I normally am. However, I did perceive the ab workout as being quite challenging, and I am normally really good at anything to do with abs.  As for the butt exercises, I made it through the whole DVD but even the toning exercises had my heart pumping.  One of the segments was more ballet/pilates inspired, but it leaned more towards strength even so.  Most of them followed the same format - do a strengthening exercise for 45 seconds, go through an entire set of exercises, repeat on the other side, and then a short stretch.  All the ones I saw used body-weight, and ranged from standing exercises (lunge variations, squats) to floor exercises like donkey kicks.My only complaint was the constant talking about body image, bikini body, skinny jeans, etc.  That simply doesn't motivate me (might motivate others).  I like to think about getting stronger, and more capable.  The focus on skinny jeans and bikinis may also feel exclusionary for any man working out with this video.I will definitely be using this video, as it's quite a nice challenge, and I believe it is working on my muscles and making me stronger, all without the need for heavy weights or special equipment.
summary: this butt blaster is a keeper
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: This a good workout that is not easy. There are 5 butt and thigh workouts and one bonus ab workout, totaling one hour. Some of the workouts are high impact so if you are trying to avoid that then this might not be the DVD for you. As with most of the 10 Minute Solution workouts this is a good one.
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: This DVD does what it says it will, and that's add some lift to your backside. After only a few weeks of using this DVD (on average 3 days a week), I've noted a difference in both my tooshy and my posture. The music is upbeat, and unobtrusive, though it's not a particularly motivating mix for me. I also love that you can mix, match, and customize the workout session. Great feature, that.But as much as I enjoy this workout DVD, it's not without some problems. It expects you to jump in feet first, no easing in. On my 20 minute Beach Body DVD, there's a section specifically to familiarize you with all of the exercises that would be presented in the DVD broken down slowly. No such luck with this DVD. On top of that, some of the exercises do require some adjustment because form is favoured over speed (and in some cases, you're expected to not only have good form, but also speed). If you have a dance background, or are used to picking up choreography quickly, then it won't be a big deal, but others might find the moves overwhelming at first. Finally, they say you should have a little floor room when in reality you should have plenty of floor room, at least your size (length and width) times two, to comfortably execute some of the moves.
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: It's been a long time since I exercised regularly. There, I said it out loud. Sort of.  Anyway, feeling the ravages of age in my strength and muscle mass, I decided this would be a step in the right direction for the rehabilitation of my "core."I found the routines easy enough to follow, and though it's too soon to see results in appearance, my muscles can feel the effects of the demands upon them.I recommend...
summary: challenging work out for a beginner
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift

reviewText: For the most part each 10-Minute segment consists of 5 exercises with a 45-seconds duration, which are then repeated (in order to incorporate the other leg/side). The HIIT Butt Lift portion of the DVD is the exception, offering 8 exercises with a 20-seconds duration followed by 10 seconds of recovery (repeated twice & totaling 16 intervals). The 10 Minutes seem to include any warm-up and/or Cool-Down Stretching. And she's on point when it comes to her Counts (unlike Denise Austin at times : )Uplift Booty is the only segment where you're Standing the entire time; the rest comprise of Standing & Floor routines, which can feel a bit flip-floppy but, actually, help to rest one part of the body as you start to target another area.Although only quick demonstrations, she does show you Modifications to some of the exercises in case you have difficulty at first (especially if you're a Beginner; if you're Intermediate or Advanced, then you probably won't use them anyway). Examples of this would be Side Taps versus Lifts, regular Speed versus Up-Tempo, Bent Knees versus Extended, Forearms-plank versus Push-Up plank position...The Bonus: Amazing Abs segment is an additional 10-Minutes & is cardio-based. I would say this section along with the HIIT Butt Lift have the highest intensity level of the group.It's definitely a great all-over workout because with all those squats & lunges, it's also exercising your legs for sure. And with the frequent twisting motions, it's contributing to Core training too.Controlling one's balance might pose an early challenge, but I'm guessing the program will only improve one's equilibrium before long.Plus she puts a modern spin on everything, teaching you so many alternate versions of classic standards (because, like she explains, it saves time to combine certain elements). I have about 20-years worth of fitness videos, yet moves like the Frog Press, Plank Jacks, & Pretzel Kicks are new to me.The 10-Minute Segments are perfect for the busy bees who have little free time to workout or those of us who are couch potatoes, lacking the proper motivation right now to devote an hour out of the day towards fitness (rather than TV or food : ) But obviously you can choose to complete 1 up to 6 (as short as 10 minutes  or as long as 60).It's helpful that not a lot of space is required to perform these routines either (just enough room really to lunge forward & backward and/or get into Plank position on the floor).Lastly, you can Select the order in which to play them in, depending on your personal preferences (& even that Clears once finished, so you can make changes daily if you want; I think we're all pretty familiar with the concept of varying one's workout regimen to avoid the dreaded plateau). Anyway, I think this DVD will do a body good.
Title: 10 Minute Solution: Butt Lift
